| History                 = 
===Origins===
The Goths were descendants of a mixed race including [[Vanir (Nordheimr)|Vanir]], [[Aesir (Nordheimr)|Aesir]], and [[Cimmerians]].{{r|Blockbusters of the Marvel Universe #1|; [[Great Cataclysm]]'s entry}}

The Goths were the ancestors of the other [[Scandinavia]]n and [[Germany|Germanic]] tribes, including the [[Anglo-Saxons]].{{r|Blockbusters of the Marvel Universe #1|; [[Great Cataclysm]]'s entry}}

===2nd century B.C.===
Circa the 2nd century B.C., Germanic tribes, including the Goths, the [[Franks]], the [[Teutons]], the [[Suevi]], the [[Cherusci]], the [[Swabians]], the [[Alamani]], and the [[Bavarians]], migrated into an area of northern [[Europ]] that was previously held by the [[Celts]], soon became the dominant culture, and was clashed with the neighboring [[Roman Empire]]. They attacked [[Gaul]] and repelled the advances of the [[Roman Empire]] into the regions east of the [[Rhine]].{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Germany]]'s entry}}

===End of the Roman Empire===
When the Roman Empire declined, the Germanic tribes whittled away at its territory.{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Germany]]'s entry}} [[Alaric (Goths) (Earth-616)|Alaric]] and his Goths (including a previous incarnation of [[James Allison (Earth-616)|James Allison]]) were key elements in the fall of that empire.{{r|Conan: Serpent War #1}}<!-- concerning the links, Western Roman Empire should be mentioned, but none of the references mentions it so far -->

===5th century AD===
By the [[5th century]], the Germanic tribes occupied much of the [[Western Roman Empire]].{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Germany]]'s entry}}<!--
